About_me: I am an experienced engineer with a specialty in civil structural and architectural discipline.  I support projects and consult on various discipline issues (especially in the maintenance and rejuvenation of civil assets/ equipment). I am an SME for drainage and insulation and a civil TA2
Ask_me_about: Infrastructure - Civils, Maintenance and Integrity, Steel and Concrete, and blast and non-linear applications
Discipline: Civil, Structures and Offshore;Technical Safety Engineering
Education: City College of New York - CUNY
Name: Doe, Jane 10
Publications: ASCE - Wind Loads on Petrochemical Structures
Role_Description_1: Lead a team starting with five (5) civil engineers to deliver as TA2 the FEED for the Al Karaana Petrochemicals Project ($6.5B+) -Building a petrochemical complex including a Steam Cracker, 2 Mono- Ethylene Glycol(MEG) Units, 1 Linear Alpha Olefins(LAO) Unit, 1 OXO Alcohol Unit, and Utilities and Offsite in Ras Laffan Industrial City, Qatar
Role_Description_2: Civil Structural and Architectural (CSA) project engineer and consultant. Project Support on multiple projects Managed field maintenance risk based inspection (RBI) projects and activities.
Role_Description_3: Lead Civil Structural and Architectural (CSA) project engineer and consultant. Duties include estimating, scheduling engineering and tracking of CSA pre-construction and construction activities both in house and via external engineering providers.Engineer specialist for Wind, Blast, equipment effects on structures, ASCE 7, NFPA 101 (Life Safety Code), IBC, UBC, ADA and SSBC design criteria for all disciplines. Worked on ASCE Energy Division Task Committees that are my specialty.
Skills: Fire & Blast Structural Analysis;CIVIL;Steel Concrete & Foundation Design;insulation;Wind;Tankage Engineer;Architechture & Design;Passive Fire Protection
